section.name: The Configuration file
section.p: Some global parameters of Eoulsan such as the path of the temporary directory for the step external tools can be set in a configuration file. There are two ways to use this configuration file:

ul.li: use the -conf <file> option of Eoulsan command line. The ~/.eoulsan file will not be read.

section.p: The next table summaries the available parameters for Eoulsan configuration file:

tr.td: Enable print stack trace when error occurs
Obfuscate design file when upload to AWS
Remove replicate information in design when upload to AWS

section.p: This values are overided by the values of the global parameters of a parameter file. It is useful to use a configuration file to set AWS keys to remove this entries from the parameter file. Developpers can use additiobal parameter that are not in the previous table.

subsection.name: Eoulsan configuration file sample
subsection.source:
# This is an example of configuration file for Eoulsan. # You need to use the -conf parameter or rename this file to # $HOME/.eoulsan to enable it.
# Temporary directory. # By default Eoulsan use the temporary directory for your platform. main.tmp.dir=/tmp
# Debug mode. # By default in Eoulsan the debug mode is disable. main.debug=false
